name: Matsuo Bashō
bio: Matsuo Bashō (1644 – November 28, 1694) was the most famous poet of the Edo period in Japan. He is recognized as the greatest master of haiku. His work deeply influenced the art form.

name: Yosa Buson
bio: Yosa Buson (1716 – January 17, 1784) was a Japanese poet and painter from the Edo period. He is considered one of the great masters of haiku and is known for his detailed, picturesque imagery.

name: Kobayashi Issa
bio: Kobayashi Issa (June 15, 1763 – January 5, 1828) was a Japanese poet and Buddhist priest known for his haiku, which often depicted the lives of ordinary people and small creatures with warmth and pathos.

name: Masaoka Shiki
bio: Masaoka Shiki (September 17, 1867 – September 19, 1902) was a Japanese poet, literary critic, and journalist. He is regarded as one of the four great masters of haiku, along with Bashō, Buson, and Issa, and a key figure in modernizing Japanese literature.
